content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of approximately 11 building blocks arranged in 3 layers:
- Layer 1 (bottom): 3 green rectangular blocks forming a foundation
- Layer 2 (middle): 1 red arch block in center, 2 orange triangular blocks on sides
- Layer 3 (top): 1 blue cubic block, 1 green square block, and 3 orange triangular roof pieces

## Spatial Relationships
- The base is formed by three green horizontal rectangular blocks in a row
- The middle layer has a red arch block in the center with two orange triangular blocks on each side
- The top layer has a blue cube on the right, a green square on the left, and orange triangular roof pieces forming a peak above

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:
- Block 1: Red arch piece (for doorway)
- Block 7: Blue cube (upper right section)
- Block 8: Green cube (upper left section)
- Block 9: Green horizontal flat rectangle (base left)
- Block 11: Green horizontal rectangle (base right)
- Block 9: Green horizontal flat rectangle (base center, using same block twice)
- Block 14: Orange triangular roof piece (left roof)
- Block 16: Orange triangular roof piece (right roof)
- Block 15: Orange triangular roof piece (front roof)
- Block 14: Orange triangular roof piece (back roof, using same block twice)

# Assembly Order
```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 9
   Step2: Move block with index 11
   Step3: Move block with index 9
   Step4: Move block with index 1
   Step5: Move block with index 14
   Step6: Move block with index 16
   Step7: Move block with index 8
   Step8: Move block with index 7
   Step9: Move block with index 15
   Step10: Move block with index 14
   Step11: Move block with index 14
}
```

This assembly order builds from the bottom up, first creating the foundation with green blocks, then adding the red arch doorway and side triangular pieces, followed by the cubic blocks on top, and finally completing the roof with triangular pieces.
